appId.description: The unique application identifier located within a specific application directory instance.

categories.description:
An array of string categories that describe the application. These are meant as a hint to catalogs or stores
listing apps and can be used by the Workspace Home filter.

contactEmail.description: Optional e-mail to receive queries about the application

customConfig.description: An optional set of name value pairs that can be used to deliver custom data from an App Directory to a launcher.

description.description: Description of the application. This will typically be a 1-2 paragraph style blurb about the application.

details.description:
The type specific launch details of the application. These details are intended to be vendor-agnostic and MAY be
duplicated or overridden by details provided in the hostManifests OpenFin object.

hostManifests.description:
A mapping from host name to a host-specific application manifest object or URI from which that manifest can be
retrieved. The manifest should provide details required to launch and use the application within the specified
host. The manifest MAY duplicate or override information provided in the details field. For web entries the url
is fetched from the details but you would want to specify custom view manifest options (or point to a manifest)
in the hostManifests.OpenFin.details setting. For Windows or Snapshots (other ways of rendering urls) please use
the type other and then specify the manifest type in the hostManifests.OpenFin.type setting along with the
relevant details.

icons.description:
Holds Icons used for the application, This icon could be used for entries in the OpenFin Workspace HOME, DOCK or
STORE Components

interop.description:
Metadata that describes how the application uses FDC3/Interop APIs. This metadata serves multiple purposes:
- It supports intent resolution by an OpenFin Platform/ interop agent, by declaring what intents an app listens
for.
- It may be used, for example in an app catalog UI, to find apps that 'interoperate with' other apps.
- It provides a standard location to document how the app interacts with user channels, app channels, and
intents, for use by other app developers and desktop assemblers.

lang.description:
A language tag that specifies the primary language of both the application and its entry, as defined by IETF RFC
5646.

localizedVersions.description:
Provides localized alternatives to any field of the app definition, which may also refer to an alternative
version of the application that is also localized (e.g. by providing customConfig or an alternative URL). The
keys to this object should be language tags as defined by IETF RFC 5646, e.g. en, en-GB or fr-FR.

moreInfo.description: Optional URL that provides more information about the application

name.description: The name of the application. The name should be unique within an App Directory instance.

publisher.description: The name of the company that owns the application. The publisher has control over their namespace/app/signature.

screenshots.description:
Array of images to show the user when they are looking at app description. Each image can have an optional
description/tooltip. These images could be used in the OpenFin Workspace STORE and HOME components or it could be
used by an Intent Resolver to provide a visual queue as to the application that will handle the intent.

supportEmail.description: Optional e-mail to receive support requests for the application

title.description: The title for the application, if missing use appName, typically used in a launcher UI.

tooltip.description: Optional tooltip description e.g. for a launcher or dock component

type.description:
The technology type that is used to launch and run the application. Each application type implies a particular
set of launch details.

version.description:
Version of the application. This allows multiple app versions to be defined using the same app name. This can be
a triplet but can also include things like 1.2.5 (BETA)

AppDefinitionType.description:
The technology type that is used to launch and run the application. Each application type implies a particular set of
launch details.

type.description: Image media type. If not present the platform may use the src file extension

contexts.description:
Required. A comma separated list of the types of contexts the intent offered by the application can process,
where the first part of the context type is the namespace e.g."fdc3.contact, org.companyname.contact"

customConfig.description: Custom configuration for the intent that may be required for a particular desktop agent.

displayName.description: An optional display name for the intent that may be used in UI instead of the name.

resultType.description:
An optional type for output returned by the application, if any, when resolving this intent. May indicate a
context type by type name (e.g. "fdc3.instrument"), a channel (e.g. "channel") or a combination that indicates a
channel that returns a particular context type (e.g. "channel<fdc3.instrument>").

appChannels.description: Describes the application's use of App Channels.

broadcasts.description: Context type names that are broadcast by the application on the channel.

description.description: A description of how the channel is used.

listensFor.description: Context type names that the application listens for on the channel.

name.description: The name of the App Channel.

intents.description: Describes the app's interactions with intents.

listensFor.description:
A mapping of Intents names that an app listens for via fdc3.addIntentListener() or
fin.me.interop.registerIntentHandler. Used to support intent resolution by the interop broker. Replaces the
intents array used previously.

raises.description:
A mapping of Intent names that an app raises (via fdc3.raiseIntent) to an array of context type names that it
may be raised with. Use the intent name "any" to represent use of the fdc3.raiseIntentForContext and
fdc3.findIntentForContext functions, which allow the user to select from intents available for a specified
context type.

userChannels.description: Describes the application's use of context types on User Channels.

broadcasts.description: Context type names that are broadcast by the application.

listensFor.description: Context type names that the application listens for.

alias.description: The Citrix alias / name of the virtual app (passed to the Citrix SelfService qlaunch parameter).

arguments.description: Arguments that must be passed on the command line to launch the app in the expected configuration.

DelayStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that waits for the given time period, checks if a process has
a window and if so, captures that window and registers it with the Snap Server

delayMs.description: How to wait in milliseconds after process launch before looking for a window

FDC3VTwoPointZeroAppDirectoryResponse.description: The successful response expected from a FDC3 2.0 request when all applications are requested.

$schema.description: The schema that helps guide the structure of the response

message.description: Response message providing status of query

metadata.description:
Metadata that provides information beyond the url path to help identify the format of the response that has been
received.

HostLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to the host of the content

disableMultiplePages.description: Should the host support multi layouts (e.g. pages). Assumes the default for each host will be used.

disableToolbarOptions.description: Should the toolbar options of a window be hidden if they are available?

hasHeaders.description: Should the header for the content be hidden

icon.description: The Icon you would prefer the window shows.

pageIcon.description: If this host supports multiple layouts what should the icon be for the layout (e.g. page) be?

pageTitle.description: If this host supports multiple layouts what should the layout (e.g page) title be?

title.description: If specified it indicates a preference to be used by this type of host.

url.description: If specified it indicates you do not want to use a browser window for this view but a platform window.

HostManifests.description:
A mapping from host name to a host-specific application manifest object or URI from which that manifest can be
retrieved. The manifest should provide details required to launch and use the application within the specified
host. The manifest MAY duplicate or override information provided in the details field. For web entries the url
is fetched from the details but you would want to specify custom view manifest options (or point to a manifest)
in the hostManifests.OpenFin.details setting. For Windows or Snapshots (other ways of rendering urls) please use
the type other and then specify the manifest type in the hostManifests.OpenFin.type setting along with the
relevant details.

OpenFin.description: The OpenFin settings for this FDC3 2.0 App Definition

config.description:
An area for config related to this app for the platform hosting it. This isn't specific to the app
manifest but how the platform can manage the app.

autostart.description:
does the application wish to be automatically started when the platform is initialized. Default
behavior is false.

instanceMode.description:
This only applies to web views/windows. Default is multi instance. Should we aim to only launch one
instance of this application and only show the app even if the intent resolver ui supports instances
of apps. If multi should we support multiple instances and let the user decide whether to launch a
new instance or pick an existing one from the intent picker? If new it means the intent picker will
not show the option to pick an instance because the app owner wants a new instance every time. And if
an intent is raised and just the id of the app is specified it will always launch a new instance

launchPreference.description: Contains additional information related to the launch of an application.

private.description:
Should this app be private and not listed in any UI e.g. Workspace HOME, DOCK or STORE (useful if it
is intended to be a background window that acts as an intent handler)

details.description:
this can be a path to a manifest file specific to this type of it can be the manifest object itself if
using an inline type or extending the details from the root.

type.description: this is the manifest type id used by OpenFin and specified if root type is defined as other.

LaunchPreference.description: Are there any preferences you would like to apply when launching this application?

bounds.description: Do you wish to specify a custom height/width and/or x/y position that should be used when this application is launched?

defaultCentered.description: Should the launched UI be positioned in the center of the screen?

options.description: Are there any app type specific options you would like to apply?

arguments.description: Arguments that must be passed on the command line to launch the app in the expected configuration.

path.description: The path on disk from which the application is launched.

NativeLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a native app

native.description: Launch Preferences related to native apps

arguments.description: Arguments are set as an array for compatibility with appAssets, launchExternalProcess and Snap.

snap.description: If specified it indicates the native app should be included when snapping.

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a native app. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

NativePreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

NativePreferenceName.description: A list of native related settings that can be updated.

OtherAppDetails.description: Use an empty object here and fill in the details object in the OpenFin definition in the hostManifests section

Preference.T.description: A list of Web related constraints

type.description: Image media type. If not present the platform may use the src file extension

SnapLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to the app when used in a snap context

strategy.description: The strategy for launching and locating the application.

ViewLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a view

host.description: If specified it indicates wish to specify specific host settings for this content.

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a view. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

view.description: The option to override a few settings that are specific to views.

ViewPreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

ViewPreferenceName.description: The different type of settings that might apply to a view

ViewPreferenceUrl.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

constraint.description: Is there a constraint that the platform can apply?

WaitForWindowClassStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that looks for a window whose underlying OS class type matches the given regular expression.
It will timeout after the given time period if no window is found.

matchRegex.description: A regular expression string to match the window class against

timeoutMs.description: The timeout period milliseconds after which the window search will be abandoned

WaitForWindowNameStrategy.description:
A window launch discovery strategy that looks for a window whose caption matches the given regular expression.
It will timeout after the given time period if no window is found.

matchRegex.description: A regular expression string to match the window caption against

timeoutMs.description: The timeout period milliseconds after which the window search will be abandoned

WebPreferenceName.description: A list of web related settings that can be updated.

WindowLaunchOptions.description: Additional options that apply to a window

updatable.description:
What can be specified when launching a window. This is an array of named types to reflect the properties you are happy to be specified.
By default nothing can be set outside of the app definition when launching the app.

window.description: The option to override a few settings that are specific to windows.

WindowPreference<never>.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

WindowPreferenceUrl.description: Which Launch Options are updatable and are there any constraints

constraint.description: Is there a constraint that the platform can apply?

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._

__type_2.description: Information relevant to the Interop Broker.

currentContextGroup.description: Context Group for the client. (green, yellow, red, etc.).

providerId.description: When provided, automatically connects the client to the specified provider uuid.

customData.description:
A field that the user can attach serializable data to be ferried around with the window options.
_When omitted, _inherits_ from the parent application._
